body.p:
Called Jonesville (after Charles S. Jones, a major local landowner) as early as 1848. The first railway (the Nashville and Chattanooga Railroad) was constructed to the town in
Bridgeport Railroad Depot 1852, and a bridge was constructed over the nearby Tennessee River in 1854 to connect the settlement with Chattanooga, Tennessee. The name of the town was then changed to Bridgeport to reflect the new construction.
